subject: Programming
title: Permissive Licenses
description: A short lesson to help you apply Permissive Licenses.

hook.text: Not every open source developer wants copyleft. Some just say: do whatever you want.

buildup.text: MIT and BSD licenses let anyone use, modify, and even sell the code without restrictions.

discovery.text: Apple built macOS on BSD-licensed code. They kept their changes proprietary. Perfectly legal.

twist.text: Permissive licenses maximize adoption but don't guarantee improvements flow back to the community.

climax.text: Today, permissive licenses dominate. Most new open source projects choose MIT over GPL.

punchline.text: Maximum freedom means freedom to close the code too.

quiz.question: What do permissive licenses like MIT allow?
